recipe.title: How to Make Vanilla Slice
recipe.intro: Vanilla slice is a popular Australian pastry. It has layers of puff pastry and thick vanilla custard. Australians sometimes call it a 'snot block' because the custard is slippery!
recipe.ingredients: puff pastry sheets, milk, sugar, cornflour, eggs, vanilla extract, butter, icing sugar
steps: **Place** two sheets of puff pastry on a baking tray and **prick** them with a fork.
**Bake** the pastry for 15 minutes until golden and flat.
**Heat** the milk in a saucepan. In a bowl, **mix** the cornflour, sugar, eggs, and vanilla.
**Pour** the hot milk into the bowl slowly, and **stir** well. **Return** the mixture to the saucepan and **cook** until thick.
**Spread** the custard on one pastry sheet. **Place** the other sheet on top. **Dust** with icing sugar and **chill** in the fridge for two hours.

quiz1.explanation_correct: æ­£è§£ï¼"Chill in the fridge for two hours."

review.text: I always go to Grafton Street Bakehouse for their vanilla slice. It is the best in Cairns! The pastry is crispy and the custard is smooth and creamy. They make it fresh every day. My workmate calls it a 'snot block' which is funny but true because the custard slides everywhere when you bite it. I also tried their meat pie. It was delicious too. Great prices and friendly staff.

quiz2.explanation_correct: æ­£è§£ï¼"My workmate calls it a 'snot block'."

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Good afternoon! What would you like today?

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.text: Hi there! What is that yellow thing in the display case?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: That is our vanilla slice. It is puff pastry with vanilla custard inside.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.text: Oh, is that what people call a snot block?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Ha ha, yes! Be careful, the custard can be messy.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.text: Sounds fun! I will take one, please. And a long black coffee.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Good choice! Would you like sugar with your coffee?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: No worries! That is eleven dollars, please.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.text: Here is my card. Thanks, mate!

part_a.full_text: Have you ever tried a vanilla slice? No, I haven't. What is it like? It is really yummy. There are two layers of pastry with custard in the middle. Sounds good. Is it easy to eat? Not really. The custard squeezes out when you bite it. That is why people call it a snot block! Ha ha, that is a funny name. You should try one at the bakery near the station. They make the best ones in town.

part_b.full_text: Good news, everyone! Starting this Monday, we have three new items on our menu. First, a chocolate vanilla slice with dark chocolate on top. It costs six dollars fifty. Second, a mini vanilla slice for kids. It is only three dollars. Third, a vanilla slice ice cream sandwich. We put vanilla ice cream between two pieces of pastry. It is eight dollars. All new items are available from nine in the morning until we sell out. Come early because they go fast!

try_it.example: Yesterday I ate a cream puff at the cafÃ©. The custard was smooth and sweet. It was a bit messy, but very delicious!
